segment.source: App-V 4.5 SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: App-V 4.5 SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: App-V 4.5 SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: App-V 4.5 SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: App-V 4.5 SP2 Release Notes
segment.target: App-V 4.5 SP2 Release Notes

segment.source: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System.
segment.target: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System.

segment.source: These Release Notes contain information that you need to successfully install the Application Virtualization Management System.
segment.target: These Release Notes contain information that you need to successfully install the Application Virtualization Management System.

segment.source: These Release Notes contain information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: These Release Notes contain information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a discrepancy between these Release Notes and other Application Virtualization Management System documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a discrepancy between these Release Notes and other Application Virtualization Management System documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: For updated information about known issues, please visit the Microsoft TechNet Library at App-V 4.5 SP2 Release Notes (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=184640).
segment.target: For updated information about known issues, please visit the Microsoft TechNet Library at App-V 4.5 SP2 Release Notes (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=184640).

segment.source: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Service Pack 2
segment.target: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Service Pack 2

segment.source: These Release Notes have been updated to reflect the changes introduced with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 Service Pack 2 (SP2).
segment.target: These Release Notes have been updated to reflect the changes introduced with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 Service Pack 2 (SP2).

segment.source: This service pack contains the following changes:
segment.target: This service pack contains the following changes:

segment.source: Support for Office 2010: App-V 4.5 SP2 now supports the virtualization of Microsoft Office 2010.
segment.target: Support for Office 2010: App-V 4.5 SP2 now supports the virtualization of Microsoft Office 2010.

segment.source: For prescriptive guidance for sequencing Microsoft Office 2010 with App-V 4.5 SP2, see Prescriptive guidance for sequencing Office 2010 in Microsoft App-V 4.6 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191539).
segment.target: For prescriptive guidance for sequencing Microsoft Office 2010 with App-V 4.5 SP2, see Prescriptive guidance for sequencing Office 2010 in Microsoft App-V 4.6 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191539).

segment.source: Support for Database Mirroring: App-V 4.5 SP2 now supports Microsoft SQL Server Database Mirroring.
segment.target: Support for Database Mirroring: App-V 4.5 SP2 now supports Microsoft SQL Server Database Mirroring.

segment.source: For more information about configuring database mirroring in your App-V environment, see How to Configure Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring Support for App-V (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=190880).
segment.target: For more information about configuring database mirroring in your App-V environment, see How to Configure Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring Support for App-V (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=190880).

segment.source: Customer Feedback and Hotfix Rollup: App-V 4.5 SP2 also includes a rollup of fixes to address issues found after the App-V 4.5 SP1 release.
segment.target: Customer Feedback and Hotfix Rollup: App-V 4.5 SP2 also includes a rollup of fixes to address issues found after the App-V 4.5 SP1 release.

segment.source: The updates address a combination of known issues and customer feedback from Microsoft internal teams, partners, and customers who are using App-V 4.5.
segment.target: The updates address a combination of known issues and customer feedback from Microsoft internal teams, partners, and customers who are using App-V 4.5.

segment.source: For a full list of the updates, see article 980847 in the Microsoft Knowledge Base (KB) at Description of Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Service Pack 2 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191540).
segment.target: For a full list of the updates, see article 980847 in the Microsoft Knowledge Base (KB) at Description of Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Service Pack 2 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=191540).

segment.source: About the Product Documentation
segment.target: About the Product Documentation

segment.source: Comprehensive documentation for Application Virtualization (App-V) is available on Microsoft TechNet in the Application Virtualization TechCenter Library (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122939).
segment.target: Comprehensive documentation for Application Virtualization (App-V) is available on Microsoft TechNet in the Application Virtualization TechCenter Library (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122939).

segment.source: The TechNet documentation includes the online Help for the Application Virtualization Sequencer, the Application Virtualization Clients, and the Application Virtualization Server.
segment.target: The TechNet documentation includes the online Help for the Application Virtualization Sequencer, the Application Virtualization Clients, and the Application Virtualization Server.

segment.source: It also includes the Application Virtualization Planning and Deployment Guide and the Application Virtualization Operations Guide.
segment.target: It also includes the Application Virtualization Planning and Deployment Guide and the Application Virtualization Operations Guide.

segment.source: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses
segment.target: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses

segment.source: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, we recommend that you install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.
segment.target: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, we recommend that you install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.

segment.source: For more information, see Microsoft Security (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).
segment.target: For more information, see Microsoft Security (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).

segment.source: Provide Feedback
segment.target: Provide Feedback

segment.source: You can provide feedback, make a suggestion, or report an issue with the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management System through the community forum on the Application Virtualization TechCenter App-V Documentation Forum (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122917).
segment.target: You can provide feedback, make a suggestion, or report an issue with the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management System through the community forum on the Application Virtualization TechCenter App-V Documentation Forum (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122917).

segment.source: You can also send your documentation feedback directly to the App-V documentation team at appvdocs@microsoft.com.
segment.target: You can also send your documentation feedback directly to the App-V documentation team at appvdocs@microsoft.com.

segment.source: Known Issues with Application Virtualization 4.5 SP2
segment.target: Known Issues with Application Virtualization 4.5 SP2

segment.source: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 SP2.
segment.target: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 SP2.

segment.source: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.
segment.target: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.

segment.source: Whenever possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases of the software.
segment.target: Whenever possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases of the software.

segment.source: Guidance for installing Server Management Console
segment.target: Guidance for installing Server Management Console

segment.source: If you have to install management software on systems other than the primary Application Virtualization publishing and streaming server, the server installation supports installing the Application Virtualization Management Console and Application Virtualization Management Web service on separate servers from the primary App-V Management Server.
segment.target: If you have to install management software on systems other than the primary Application Virtualization publishing and streaming server, the server installation supports installing the Application Virtualization Management Console and Application Virtualization Management Web service on separate servers from the primary App-V Management Server.

segment.source: To distribute the management components across multiple servers, Kerberos delegation must be enabled on the server where the Application Virtualization Web service is installed.
segment.target: To distribute the management components across multiple servers, Kerberos delegation must be enabled on the server where the Application Virtualization Web service is installed.

segment.source: For information about how to enable this support, see How to Configure the Server to be Trusted for Delegation (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=166682).
segment.target: For information about how to enable this support, see How to Configure the Server to be Trusted for Delegation (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=166682).

segment.source: Guidance for installing or upgrading clients to App-V 4.5 SP2 by using Setup.msi
segment.target: Guidance for installing or upgrading clients to App-V 4.5 SP2 by using Setup.msi

segment.source: When installing or upgrading your App-V Clients to App-V 4.5 SP2 by using Setup.msi, the prerequisites are not installed automatically.
segment.target: When installing or upgrading your App-V Clients to App-V 4.5 SP2 by using Setup.msi, the prerequisites are not installed automatically.

segment.source: WORKAROUND You must manually install the prerequisites before installing or upgrading the App-V Clients to App-V 4.5 SP2.
segment.target: WORKAROUND You must manually install the prerequisites before installing or upgrading the App-V Clients to App-V 4.5 SP2.

segment.source: For detailed procedures about how to install the prerequisites and the App-V Client, see How to Install the Client by Using the Command Line (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144106).
segment.target: For detailed procedures about how to install the prerequisites and the App-V Client, see How to Install the Client by Using the Command Line (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144106).

segment.source: When this has been completed, install the App-V 4.5 SP2 Clients by using Setup.msi with administrative credentials.
segment.target: When this has been completed, install the App-V 4.5 SP2 Clients by using Setup.msi with administrative credentials.

segment.source: This file is available on the App-V 4.5 SP2 release media in the InstallersClient folder.
segment.target: This file is available on the App-V 4.5 SP2 release media in the InstallersClient folder.

segment.source: When installing Microsoft Application Error Reporting, use the following command if you are installing or upgrading to the App-V 4.5 SP2 Desktop Client:
segment.target: When installing Microsoft Application Error Reporting, use the following command if you are installing or upgrading to the App-V 4.5 SP2 Desktop Client:

segment.source: msiexec /i dw20shared.msi APPGUID={C6FC75B9-7D86-4C44-8BDB-EAFE1F0E200D} allusers=1 reboot=suppress REINSTALL=all REINSTALLMODE=vomus
segment.target: msiexec /i dw20shared.msi APPGUID={C6FC75B9-7D86-4C44-8BDB-EAFE1F0E200D} allusers=1 reboot=suppress REINSTALL=all REINSTALLMODE=vomus

segment.source: Alternatively, if you are installing or upgrading to the App-V 4.5 SP2 Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), use the following command:
segment.target: Alternatively, if you are installing or upgrading to the App-V 4.5 SP2 Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), use the following command:

segment.source: msiexec /i dw20shared.msi APPGUID={ECF80BBA-CA07-4A74-9ED6-E064F38AF1F5} allusers=1 reboot=suppress REINSTALL=all REINSTALLMODE=vomus
segment.target: msiexec /i dw20shared.msi APPGUID={ECF80BBA-CA07-4A74-9ED6-E064F38AF1F5} allusers=1 reboot=suppress REINSTALL=all REINSTALLMODE=vomus

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The APPGUID parameter references the product code of the App-V Clients that you install or upgrade.
segment.target: The APPGUID parameter references the product code of the App-V Clients that you install or upgrade.

segment.source: The product code is unique for each Setup.msi.
segment.target: The product code is unique for each Setup.msi.

segment.source: You can use the Orca Database Editor or a similar tool to examine Windows Installer files and determine the product code.
segment.target: You can use the Orca Database Editor or a similar tool to examine Windows Installer files and determine the product code.

segment.source: This step is required for all installations or upgrades to App-V 4.5 SP2.
segment.target: This step is required for all installations or upgrades to App-V 4.5 SP2.

segment.source: This step is not required if you are upgrading and have previously installed Dw20shared.msi.
segment.target: This step is not required if you are upgrading and have previously installed Dw20shared.msi.

segment.source: Improving performance when sequencing the .NET Framework
segment.target: Improving performance when sequencing the .NET Framework

segment.source: When sequencing the Microsoft .NET Framework, you might experience reduced system performance because the .NET Framework NGEN service attempts to precompile assemblies as a background task.
segment.target: When sequencing the Microsoft .NET Framework, you might experience reduced system performance because the .NET Framework NGEN service attempts to precompile assemblies as a background task.

segment.source: WORKAROUND When sequencing the .NET Framework, disable the .NET Framework NGEN service (Mscorsvw.exe) after completing the monitoring phase.
segment.target: WORKAROUND When sequencing the .NET Framework, disable the .NET Framework NGEN service (Mscorsvw.exe) after completing the monitoring phase.

segment.source: You must use the Virtual Services tab in the App-V Sequencer and change the startup type to Disabled.
segment.target: You must use the Virtual Services tab in the App-V Sequencer and change the startup type to Disabled.

segment.source: When you uninstall the Microsoft Application Virtualization Client, user settings associated with the user performing the uninstallation are deleted
segment.target: When you uninstall the Microsoft Application Virtualization Client, user settings associated with the user performing the uninstallation are deleted

segment.source: When you uninstall the App-V Client, the Windows Installer removes Application Virtualization settings from the current user's profile.
segment.target: When you uninstall the App-V Client, the Windows Installer removes Application Virtualization settings from the current user's profile.

segment.source: If your computer uses roaming profiles, do not use your personal network account to uninstall the client because it will remove settings for your virtual applications on all of your computers.
segment.target: If your computer uses roaming profiles, do not use your personal network account to uninstall the client because it will remove settings for your virtual applications on all of your computers.

segment.source: WORKAROUND You must uninstall the App-V Client with an administrative account that is not used for running virtual applications.
segment.target: WORKAROUND You must uninstall the App-V Client with an administrative account that is not used for running virtual applications.

segment.source: Edits made on the virtual file system and virtual registry tabs must be saved while running the Sequencing wizard
segment.target: Edits made on the virtual file system and virtual registry tabs must be saved while running the Sequencing wizard

segment.source: If you open a package to perform an upgrade, or if you have already run the Sequencing wizard with a new package and make changes to the package in the virtual file system or virtual registry tabs, those changes are not automatically saved.
segment.target: If you open a package to perform an upgrade, or if you have already run the Sequencing wizard with a new package and make changes to the package in the virtual file system or virtual registry tabs, those changes are not automatically saved.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Save the changes before re-running the wizard, to ensure that they are reflected inside the wizard’s virtual environment.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Save the changes before re-running the wizard, to ensure that they are reflected inside the wizard’s virtual environment.

segment.source: Command-line Sequencer must be run from an elevated command prompt
segment.target: Command-line Sequencer must be run from an elevated command prompt

segment.source: When you use the command-line Sequencer, it does not prompt for elevation.
segment.target: When you use the command-line Sequencer, it does not prompt for elevation.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Run the command-line Sequencer by using an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Run the command-line Sequencer by using an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: Short path variable names in OSD files can cause errors
segment.target: Short path variable names in OSD files can cause errors

segment.source: If you receive error 450478-1F702339-0000010B "The directory name is invalid" when starting a virtual application on the client, it is possible that the variable in the OSD is set incorrectly.
segment.target: If you receive error 450478-1F702339-0000010B "The directory name is invalid" when starting a virtual application on the client, it is possible that the variable in the OSD is set incorrectly.

segment.source: This can happen if the application’s installer sets a short path name during sequencing.
segment.target: This can happen if the application’s installer sets a short path name during sequencing.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Remove the trailing tilde from any CSIDL variable that exists in the OSD file.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Remove the trailing tilde from any CSIDL variable that exists in the OSD file.

segment.source: Correct syntax for DECODEPATH parameter for command-line Sequencer
segment.target: Correct syntax for DECODEPATH parameter for command-line Sequencer

segment.source: In the command-line Sequencer, when opening a package for upgrade and decoding it to the root of drive Q, the syntax for the DECODEPATH parameter should not include a trailing slash.
segment.target: In the command-line Sequencer, when opening a package for upgrade and decoding it to the root of drive Q, the syntax for the DECODEPATH parameter should not include a trailing slash.

segment.source: WORKAROUND You can use Q: rather than Q: (omitting the trailing "" character).
segment.target: WORKAROUND You can use Q: rather than Q: (omitting the trailing "" character).

segment.source: When upgrading APP-V 4.2 packages, you encounter problems caused by Windows Installer files in the Virtual File System
segment.target: When upgrading APP-V 4.2 packages, you encounter problems caused by Windows Installer files in the Virtual File System

segment.source: When upgrading a package from APP-V 4.2, you might experience issues relating to a mismatch of Windows Installer system files that were included by default in APP-V 4.2 and the Windows Installer libraries locally installed on your Sequencing workstation.
segment.target: When upgrading a package from APP-V 4.2, you might experience issues relating to a mismatch of Windows Installer system files that were included by default in APP-V 4.2 and the Windows Installer libraries locally installed on your Sequencing workstation.

segment.source: The following files are located in CSIDLSYSTEM:
segment.target: The following files are located in CSIDLSYSTEM:

segment.source: Cabinet.dll
segment.target: Cabinet.dll

segment.source: Msi.dll
segment.target: Msi.dll

segment.source: Msiexec.exe
segment.target: Msiexec.exe

segment.source: Msihnd.dll
segment.target: Msihnd.dll

segment.source: Msimsg.dlll
segment.target: Msimsg.dlll

segment.source: WORKAROUND Delete all of the preceding files from the package.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Delete all of the preceding files from the package.

segment.source: Delete the mappings on the VFS tab and the actual files in the CSIDLSYSTEM folder in your decode path.
segment.target: Delete the mappings on the VFS tab and the actual files in the CSIDLSYSTEM folder in your decode path.

segment.source: On Windows XP, by default, client installation logging is not enabled
segment.target: On Windows XP, by default, client installation logging is not enabled

segment.source: When installing the client, to ensure that any install errors are captured for troubleshooting, you must enable logging by using the command line.
segment.target: When installing the client, to ensure that any install errors are captured for troubleshooting, you must enable logging by using the command line.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Add the parameter /lvx! log.txt to the command line, as shown in the following example:
segment.target: WORKAROUND Add the parameter /lvx! log.txt to the command line, as shown in the following example:

segment.source: setup.exe /s /v”/qn /lvx!
segment.target: setup.exe /s /v”/qn /lvx!

segment.source: log.txt”
segment.target: log.txt”

segment.source: msiexec.exe /i setup.msi /qn /lvx!
segment.target: msiexec.exe /i setup.msi /qn /lvx!

segment.source: log.txt
segment.target: log.txt

segment.source: Alternatively, you can set the registry key to the following value:
segment.target: Alternatively, you can set the registry key to the following value:

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREPoliciesMicrosoftWindowsInstaller "Logging"="voicewarmupx!"
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREPoliciesMicrosoftWindowsInstaller "Logging"="voicewarmupx!"

segment.source: For Kerberos authentication to work, Service Principal Names (SPNs) must be registered for IIS
segment.target: For Kerberos authentication to work, Service Principal Names (SPNs) must be registered for IIS

segment.source: When using Internet Information Services (IIS) 6.0 or IIS 7.0 for icon or OSD file retrieval and streaming of packages, to enable Kerberos authentication, the SPNs must be registered as follows:
segment.target: When using Internet Information Services (IIS) 6.0 or IIS 7.0 for icon or OSD file retrieval and streaming of packages, to enable Kerberos authentication, the SPNs must be registered as follows:

segment.source: On the IIS server, run the following commands by using the SETSPN.EXE Resource Kit tool.
segment.target: On the IIS server, run the following commands by using the SETSPN.EXE Resource Kit tool.

segment.source: The server fully qualified domain name (FQDN) must be used.
segment.target: The server fully qualified domain name (FQDN) must be used.

segment.source: Setspn -r SOFTGRID/Server FQDN
segment.target: Setspn -r SOFTGRID/Server FQDN

segment.source: Setspn -r HTTP/Server FQDN
segment.target: Setspn -r HTTP/Server FQDN

segment.source: For more information, see Integrated Windows Authentication (IIS 6.0) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=131407).
segment.target: For more information, see Integrated Windows Authentication (IIS 6.0) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=131407).

segment.source: .NET compatibility changes
segment.target: .NET compatibility changes

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Cumulative Update 1 or later supports sequencing the .NET Framework on Windows XP SP2 or later.
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Cumulative Update 1 or later supports sequencing the .NET Framework on Windows XP SP2 or later.

segment.source: Sequencing routines for .NET applications that were written for SoftGrid 4.2 might have to be updated when used with the App-V 4.5 Sequencer.
segment.target: Sequencing routines for .NET applications that were written for SoftGrid 4.2 might have to be updated when used with the App-V 4.5 Sequencer.

segment.source: For details and workarounds, see the Application Virtualization TechCenter article at Support for .NET in Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=123412).
segment.target: For details and workarounds, see the Application Virtualization TechCenter article at Support for .NET in Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=123412).

segment.source: After client upgrade from App-V 4.2, some applications are not shown
segment.target: After client upgrade from App-V 4.2, some applications are not shown

segment.source: Check for the following error in the log: "The Application Virtualization Client could not parse the OSD file".
segment.target: Check for the following error in the log: "The Application Virtualization Client could not parse the OSD file".

segment.source: The App-V 4.5 Client filters out applications that have an OSD file that contains an empty OS tag (OS/OS).
segment.target: The App-V 4.5 Client filters out applications that have an OSD file that contains an empty OS tag (OS/OS).

segment.source: WORKAROUND Delete the empty OS tag from the OSD file.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Delete the empty OS tag from the OSD file.

segment.source: The App-V server requires exemptions in its firewall for certain processes
segment.target: The App-V server requires exemptions in its firewall for certain processes

segment.source: For the server to stream applications correctly, the server's core processes, including the dispatcher, require access through the firewall.
segment.target: For the server to stream applications correctly, the server's core processes, including the dispatcher, require access through the firewall.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Set exemptions in the server's firewall for the following processes: Sghwsvr.exe and Sghwdsptr.exe.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Set exemptions in the server's firewall for the following processes: Sghwsvr.exe and Sghwdsptr.exe.

segment.source: This applies to the App-V Management Server and App-V Streaming Server.
segment.target: This applies to the App-V Management Server and App-V Streaming Server.

segment.source: When the server installer is run in silent mode, it does not correctly check for MSXML6
segment.target: When the server installer is run in silent mode, it does not correctly check for MSXML6

segment.source: The App-V Management Server depends on MSXML6.
segment.target: The App-V Management Server depends on MSXML6.

segment.source: However, if you run the installer in silent mode—for example, by using the command msiexec -i setup.msi /qn on a system where MSXML6 is not already installed—the installer does not detect the missing dependency and installs anyway.
segment.target: However, if you run the installer in silent mode—for example, by using the command msiexec -i setup.msi /qn on a system where MSXML6 is not already installed—the installer does not detect the missing dependency and installs anyway.

segment.source: Therefore, when clients attempt to refresh publishing information from the App-V Management Server, they will get errors.
segment.target: Therefore, when clients attempt to refresh publishing information from the App-V Management Server, they will get errors.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Verify that MSXML6 is installed on the system before attempting a silent installation of the App-V Management Server.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Verify that MSXML6 is installed on the system before attempting a silent installation of the App-V Management Server.

segment.source: Error code 000C800 when attempting to connect to the Application Virtualization Management Console
segment.target: Error code 000C800 when attempting to connect to the Application Virtualization Management Console

segment.source: An Application Virtualization administrator who is not a local administrator on the App-V Management Web Service server receives an error (Error code: 000C800) when attempting to connect to the App-V Management Console, and the Sftmmc.log entry indicates that access to SftMgmt.udl is denied.
segment.target: An Application Virtualization administrator who is not a local administrator on the App-V Management Web Service server receives an error (Error code: 000C800) when attempting to connect to the App-V Management Console, and the Sftmmc.log entry indicates that access to SftMgmt.udl is denied.

segment.source: To successfully connect to the App-V Management Console, an administrator who does not have local administrator rights on the App-V Management Web Service server must have at least Read and Execute permissions to the SftMgmt.udl file.
segment.target: To successfully connect to the App-V Management Console, an administrator who does not have local administrator rights on the App-V Management Web Service server must have at least Read and Execute permissions to the SftMgmt.udl file.

segment.source: Application Virtualization administrators must have Read and Execute permissions to the SftMgmt.UDL file in folder %systemdrive%Program FilesMicrosoft System Center App Virt Management ServerApp Virt Management Service.
segment.target: Application Virtualization administrators must have Read and Execute permissions to the SftMgmt.UDL file in folder %systemdrive%Program FilesMicrosoft System Center App Virt Management ServerApp Virt Management Service.

segment.source: Client installer command-line parameters are ignored when used in conjunction with KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1
segment.target: Client installer command-line parameters are ignored when used in conjunction with KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1

segment.source: When used in conjunction with KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1, the following client installer command-line parameters are ignored: SWICACHESIZE, MINFREESPACEMB, ALLOWINDEPENDENTFILESTREAMING, APPLICATIONSOURCEROOT, ICONSOURCEROOT, OSDSOURCEROOT, SYSTEMEVENTLOGLEVEL, SWIGLOBALDATA, DOTIMEOUTMINUTES, SWIFSDRIVE, AUTOLOADTARGET, AUTOLOADTRIGGERS, SWIUSERDATA, and REQUIRESECURECONNECTION.
segment.target: When used in conjunction with KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1, the following client installer command-line parameters are ignored: SWICACHESIZE, MINFREESPACEMB, ALLOWINDEPENDENTFILESTREAMING, APPLICATIONSOURCEROOT, ICONSOURCEROOT, OSDSOURCEROOT, SYSTEMEVENTLOGLEVEL, SWIGLOBALDATA, DOTIMEOUTMINUTES, SWIFSDRIVE, AUTOLOADTARGET, AUTOLOADTRIGGERS, SWIUSERDATA, and REQUIRESECURECONNECTION.

segment.source: WORKAROUND If you have settings you want to retain, use KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1, and then set the other parameters after deployment.
segment.target: WORKAROUND If you have settings you want to retain, use KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1, and then set the other parameters after deployment.

segment.source: The App-V ADM Template can be used to set the following client settings: APPLICATIONSOURCEROOT, ICONSOURCEROOT, OSDSOURCEROOT, AUTOLOADTARGET, AUTOLOADTRIGGERS, DOTIMEOUTMINUTES, and ALLOWINDEPENDENTFILESTREAMING.
segment.target: The App-V ADM Template can be used to set the following client settings: APPLICATIONSOURCEROOT, ICONSOURCEROOT, OSDSOURCEROOT, AUTOLOADTARGET, AUTOLOADTRIGGERS, DOTIMEOUTMINUTES, and ALLOWINDEPENDENTFILESTREAMING.

segment.source: You can download the ADM Template from the Microsoft DownLoad Center at Microsoft Application Virtualization Administrative Template (ADM Template) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=121835).
segment.target: You can download the ADM Template from the Microsoft DownLoad Center at Microsoft Application Virtualization Administrative Template (ADM Template) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=121835).

segment.source: Release Notes Copyright Information
segment.target: Release Notes Copyright Information

segment.source: This document is provided "as-is".
segment.target: This document is provided "as-is".

segment.source: Information and views expressed in this document, including URL and other Internet Web site references, may change without notice.
